meanings.definition: A unit of brightness equal to one lumen per square centimeter.
meanings.sent1: The room was well-lit with a single lambert of light shining from the lamp.
meanings.sent2: The scientist measured the lambert of the bulb to ensure proper illumination.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke that a lambert walked into a bar and asked for a spotlight!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a lambert in the darkness, bright and comforting.
meanings.sent5: The lambert of the sun at dawn painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A person with the surname Lambert.
meanings.sent1: Mr. Lambert, the teacher, was known for his kind demeanor.
meanings.sent2: The Lambert family had a reunion every summer.
meanings.sent3: Why did Lambert bring a lamb to the party? It was a family tradition!
meanings.sent4: She was as reliable as a Lambert in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The Lambert siblings always stuck together like a close-knit unit.
